channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
I think we should encourage the states that want to secede to do so. Then when they want to come back into the union, the price is they give up their electoral vote advantage and their senate seats. No more tail wagging the dog. yes i know this is not practical. ;-)
it seems that's what should have happened after the civil war. abolish the senate and electoral college, those were structurally supporting slavery, that's why we never really got past slavery. it's the same fight generation after generation. are black people slaves.
i've learned so much from reading books about slavery in the last two years, that's all i've been reading.
but if you want to get it in a quick read -- get @ElieNYC's book. it's a fire hose of perspective on what the US is about, constitutionally.
https://t.co/ML9dkpX7Il

In the early days of blogging we called this "Sources go direct." https://t.co/5G0ZgTwiBV
If we had a way of communicating with Democrats the breakthrough could have come from progressives instead of a fascist.
It's weird because we were celebrated at the 2004 DNC. They had parties for us. But they didn't listen.
@jeffjarvis They're both server errors. It means something broke in their CMS.
So much for good guys with guns. What's plan B? https://t.co/vuO9dHzQ4X
So if the Supreme Court rules on Roe today that knocks the legs from under today's Jan 6 hearing.
@GuyKawasaki but i think it's percolating out there via word of mouth. and they are doing an excellent job of posting stuff on twitter. really impressed.
@AdamSinger I quoted you on my blog. https://t.co/ocs3wYLd8Q
@AdamSinger amen.
John Eastman Is Team Trump's Pick for Jan. 6 Scapegoat. https://t.co/bt2y3r7qrh

@JNathan @infination @MrChuckD @Rosenbergradio @adamcurry Btw there was much more than writing code, though that was necessary. Someone who wasnâ€™t a professional radio person had to step up and do it, so people could see you donâ€™t need a big org behind you, or anyoneâ€™s permission, to speak and have people listen.
@JNathan @infination @MrChuckD @Rosenbergradio @adamcurry This is a better piece. https://t.co/4Oi6yCZKUe
@KnicksNation My positive feelings for the Knicks would be swamped by disgust of kyrie.
The insurrection won't end until Trump is prosecuted. https://t.co/7L15UIFnl7
As Colorado River reservoirs drop, states urged to 'act now.' https://t.co/6AcCgrpTpR
If you're looking for baseball news, I have your site. https://t.co/TdnU89Chp6
sarcasm sucks because you'd better be right and more often than not the sarcastichole is wrong.
@peterdelevett @GwashburnGlobe lebron is probably available.
@Scobleizer @siegel @bbedit zuck was lucky.

@siegel @Scobleizer @bbedit that's right, nor did he have any idea that webstar or frontier existed. i think he seriously thought he was bringing the mac up to speed in internet stuff. all seat of the pants. bbedit wasn't in the way because there was no unix editor like yours. and good for you bro.
@siegel @Scobleizer @bbedit i'm not really complaining (that much). we went on to do all kinds of stuff that he could have benefited from, instead fuck him. ðŸ˜€

@Scobleizer @bbedit hey i'm still alive. so there's that. ;-)
@Scobleizer @bbedit knock wood.
@ScruggsDJ @TaylorLorenz @jeffjarvis @mattyglesias i hate sarcasm
SUV drives into Sunflower Market in Woodstock. https://t.co/tsIbFmnXjc
@cvoxel Thanks for doing this. I added a link to your PDF at the bottom of the https://t.co/EQXyzynAnM page. https://t.co/vlTAlfufn0
@jeffjarvis @mattyglesias really
